Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp

ODP (Ordine di Pagamento - Payment Order) Management System for Menarini.

See: Description

Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp Description

ODP (Ordine di Pagamento - Payment Order) Management System for Menarini.

Overview

This package provides a complete payment order management system with support for creating, editing, searching, and approving payment orders (ODPs). The system implements a multi-step authorization workflow with role-based access control.

Architecture

The ODP system follows a layered architecture: 

 +-----------------------------------------------------+
 |  Frontend Layer (UI & Actions)                      |
 |  - Forms, Actions, ERParams, Mappers                |
 +-----------------------------------------------------+
 |  Application Layer                                  |
 |  - OdpApp (Main Application)                        |
 |  - Security Management                              |
 +-----------------------------------------------------+
 |  Service Layer                                      |
 |  - IOdpService (Business Logic)                     |
 |  - Validation & Authorization                       |
 +-----------------------------------------------------+
 |  Repository Layer                                   |
 |  - IOdpRepository (Data Access)                     |
 |  - CSV/RDBMS Implementations                        |
 +-----------------------------------------------------+
 |  Domain Model                                       |
 |  - Odp, OdpUser, OdpCompany, etc.                   |
 +-----------------------------------------------------+

Core Concepts

ODP Lifecycle

An ODP progresses through several states during its lifecycle:

  1. TEMPLATE - Master template for creating new ODPs
  2. DRAFT - Being edited by the proposer
  3. WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1 - Awaiting first signer approval
  4. WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_2 - Awaiting second signer approval (optional)
  5. WAITING_AUTH_PAYER - Awaiting payer approval
  6. PAYABLE - Fully authorized, ready for payment
  7. REJECTED - Rejected during authorization

Roles and Permissions

The system defines four user roles with specific permissions:

  • PROPOSER - Creates, edits, and deletes ODPs; submits for approval
  • SIGNER_1 - First level authorization
  • SIGNER_2 - Second level authorization (currently unused)
  • PAYER - Final authorization and payment execution

Authorization Workflow

The approval workflow follows this pattern: 

 DRAFT -> Submit -> WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1 -> Approve -> WAITING_AUTH_PAYER -> Approve -> PAYABLE
                           |                                |
                       Reject                           Reject
                           |                                |
                        REJECTED <--------------------------+

Package Structure

model

Domain model classes representing the core business entities:

  • Odp - Payment order
  • OdpUser - User with role
  • OdpCompany - Company entity
  • OdpAuthorizationFlow - Approval history
  • Supporting entities: Currency, Supplier, CDC, CDR, AccountVDS

types

Enumerations defining system constants:

  • OdpStateType - ODP lifecycle states
  • RoleType - User roles and permissions
  • PaymentType - Payment types

backend

Backend services and data access:

  • services - Business logic and validation (IOdpService)
  • repos - Data access layer with CSV implementation (IOdpRepository)

frontend

User interface components and presentation logic:

  • actions - User actions (create, edit, submit, approve)
  • forms - UI forms (search, detail, approval, tasks)
  • erparams - Form field parameters with validation
  • mappers - Data mapping between UI and domain models

Usage Example

Creating an ODP


 // 1. User (PROPOSER) creates a new ODP
 Odp odp = new Odp();
 odp.setAzienda(company);
 odp.setValuta(currency);
 odp.setFornitore(supplier);
 odp.setImporto(1000.00);
 // ... set other fields

 String odpId = odpService.createOdp(odp, "proposer123");
 // ODP created in DRAFT state

 // 2. Proposer submits for approval
 odpService.submitOdpForApproval(odpId, "proposer123");
 // ODP transitions to WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1

 // 3. First signer approves
 OdpAuthorizationStep step1 = new OdpAuthorizationStep();
 step1.setUser(signer1User);
 step1.setApproved(true);
 step1.setNotes("Approved");
 odpService.approveOdp(odpId, "password", step1);
 // ODP transitions to WAITING_AUTH_PAYER

 // 4. Payer approves
 OdpAuthorizationStep step2 = new OdpAuthorizationStep();
 step2.setUser(payerUser);
 step2.setApproved(true);
 step2.setNotes("Approved for payment");
 odpService.approveOdp(odpId, "password", step2);
 // ODP transitions to PAYABLE - ready for payment execution

Configuration

The application supports configuration parameters:

  • K1 (overrideDecoding) - Override default decoding behavior (default: false)
  • K2 (repositoryType) - Data repository type: RDBMS or CSV (default: RDBMS)

Security

The system implements role-based security through:

  • Role-based permissions checked at service layer
  • Password validation for approval operations
  • Security manager integration with BusinessLogic framework
  • State-based edit restrictions (only DRAFT/TEMPLATE can be edited)
Version:
3.0
Author:
RDS Software

OdpApp, IOdpService, Odp
